4.4.20  11:25 am   I just discovered your"reality" videos, and I love them. So often people think that well-known creators don't struggle like unknown creators do, and it's refreshing to see proof that that's not the case - that this doesn't always come easy to you and you have to work at it constantly just like anyone else.  Do you think you'll ever release more of them?

     yes, thousands probably

4.4.20  11:25 am   Do you make the songs, or do the songs make you?

     extremely both

     too heavy

     i'm having a countdown timer

     on holidays

4.4.20  9:55 am   is quarantine making you go insane

     no. i conveniently was already insane

4.4.20  9:53 am   In terms of video making, are you getting there?

     yes

      Can you see a small light?

     yes

4.4.20  9:51 am   are you sarcastic

     scientists have recently discovered that everything is sarcastic

4.4.20  9:41 am   hi Bill.

You keep saying that you haven't released a video because you are learning how to make video.

     that's true

     Did you forget that you made a bunch of videos on YouTube already?

     i didn't make them on youtube. i made them offline, and then logged into youtube to post them when they were done. also posted them here on this site as well, and some other sites

     Do you have to relearn everything when you make a new video?

     usually not, but that's what's happening now

      Are you trying to change your style?

     there are some basic advancements that seem to be inevitable, and it was actually a peculiar case of software obscelecense which triggered the transition, which was due to happen sometime anyway but i just wasn't sure when

     Please elaborate. What do you have to learn?

     the core software that i was using for video production was discontinued, actually around 2012 (before i even started using it). but by the time i found out, i was already 2 or 3 years down the road of experience with it. so i was clinging to an old computer system, year after year, and couldn't update or i would have to relearn all the tricks and techniques i had accumulated. But, there's also a secondary piece of software that i've been using in addition, ever since about 2016, to do some of the 3D elements, and sometime last year when starting on a music video i just felt deep inside that i wanted to try starting off the entire video from the 3D program, just to see what happens. i've always known 3D is a nightmare mindfuck timesink, but something must have clicked in my biological timeclock or something, and i realized it was my destiny to just jump into it, and apply all the same principles of brutal simplicity that had allowed me first enter the video making realm (an equally impossible mindfuck, back then, having had no experience). So i fell hopelessly in love with this new realm, despite some of the unthinkable challenges, and then it occured to me that this is obviously the time when i am supposed to make the jump to a new system. there is literally every reason to do it, and equally many reasons 'not' to 'not' do it. it's kind of like going through puberty. your body says it's time to change and the change happens. and let's just say that the transition has set into motion so many more ridiculous and exciting developments than i had ever could have expected, and yet needed so desperetly all along. it's like when a tree grows for 10 years under a small shelf and then the shelf breaks and the tree suddenly explodes in an upward direction. could be awkward at first but you know it's gotta happen. if you've known me, you'll know i've been through this many times before

     Thanks

     ah, i think i figured out what's going on. you have probably never seen any of the videos i have made
